overview:
Rami Al-Karmi currently heads as CEO at N2V Labs (The Digital Power House By N2V) the responsibility of the N2V Groupâ€™s strategic tech/web scale activities; by building and delivering great web ventures and managing the infrastructure arm of 100 servers and cloud machines responsible for serving > 400 million monthly pageviews at N2V (National Net Ventures) ; one of the largest internet investment companies in Arabia, focused on value creation through building and investing in Arabic consumer web & mobile ventures (e-commerce, digital publishing, social media, Games, mobile apps, web forums, and user generated content), with over 200 employees spread in offices around different Arab countries and the USA.

Rami is a member of the Group Strategic Committee at N2V, a Board Member of Hawaaworld.com ( The largest arab female online community) , GameTako.com , and a member of the Board of Trustees of Elia Nuqul Foundation.

Rami, is a serial entrepreneur who founded his 1st startup at the age of 19. and was one of 13 Jordanians who attended the Presidential summit on Entrepreneurship in Washington DC 2010. He is an Electrical Engineer, he completed the Senior Executive program at Rady School of Business at UC San Diego, the Venture Capital Executive Program at HAAS UC Berkely, and the LOA Harvard Kennedy School Executive education Program.

Back in 1998 Rami spearheaded the knowledge server team that powers aljazeera.net . then co-founded, led as CEO, or investor / board member a number of technology-based ventures, where he served Fortune 500 and (semi)Governmental corporate clients like Microsoft , Cisco , Intel across the levant and GCC regions.

Rami is deeply rooted in the arabic geeks community where he is usually referred to as (Pirate of Digital Arabia) with reference to his passion towards the Lean Startup , AARRR and Customer Development Models. He is usually a mentor & speaker during GEW & Startup weekend events , and is also famous for holding Hackathons.
